content: Theming in HeroUI is managed via a TailwindCSS plugin. The first step is to add the `heroui` plugin to your `tailwind.config.js` file to enable theme capabilities.
To use a theme, apply CSS classes to your root element (e.g., in `main.jsx`). Use `light` or `dark` for the theme, `text-foreground` for the text color, and `bg-background` for the background color.
HeroUI supports nested themes, allowing different themes for different sections of your app. You can also apply styles based on the active theme using variants like `dark:bg-blue-500`.
The `heroui` plugin can be configured with options such as `prefix`, `defaultTheme`, and `addCommonColors`. You can also define your own custom `layout` and `themes`.
Themes are built upon a structured type system for colors, including `ColorScale` (a scale from 50 to 900) and `ThemeColors`, which define palettes for `primary`, `secondary`, `danger`, etc.
